points.title: Flickr lets you choose a copyright license

tosdr.tldr: The copyright license granted to Yahoo for photos, graphics, audio and video is limited “solely for the purpose for which such Content was submitted or made available”. In addition, Flickr integrates a set of Creative Commons licenses you can choose from.
tosdr.case: you can choose the copyright license

topics.description: The level of choice that is left to the user.
topics.name: User choice
topics.subtitle: How much can YOU decide?
topics.title: User choice

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.
topics.name: Scope of the copyright license
topics.subtitle: Do you grant only the necessary rights?
topics.title: Scope of the copyright license

points.title: Users are subject to Yahoo!'s Terms of Service

tosdr.tldr: “When you use Flickr, you are subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service and Yahoo! Community Guidelines.” To find out about Yahoo!'s terms, please read the ToS;DR report.
tosdr.case: your use is subject to a policies, guidelines, etc.

topics.name: Governance
topics.subtitle: Your relationship with the service and the community
topics.title: Governance

points.title: The copyright license is limited for certain types of content

tosdr.tldr: When you submit or make publicly available, photos, graphics, audio or video content, on Yahoo Services, you grant Yahoo a licence that is limited for the purpose for which such content was submitted or made available and (if you are a user from the EU for example, that content may also be used to promote Yahoo Services across their network.) In all instances, the licence ends with the removal of the content, either by you or Yahoo/Flickr. For other types of content in publically accessible areas of Flickr or Yahoo, these limitations don't apply and the broad licence for Yahoo to use it does not end with the removal of that content.
tosdr.case: limited for purpose of same service

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.

points.title: You can chose with whom you share your photo

tosdr.tldr: “You can specify whether or not you want your photos to be accessible to the public, accessible to a select few, or private (only you can access them with your Yahoo! ID and password)”
tosdr.case: you can choose with whom you share content

topics.description: The level of choice that is left to the user.
topics.name: User choice
topics.subtitle: How much can YOU decide?
topics.title: User choice

tosdr.tldr: You can limit who sees certain information from your profile or your content through the privacy controls including searches and third party sites using the Yahoo API.

topics.description: What types of privacy controls are given to enable users to limit and share private information and content
topics.name: Privacy-controls
topics.subtitle: Privacy Controls for selective sharing
topics.title: My Data and Content

meta.author: Greer Hahn

points.title: Terms may be changed at any time, but they will notify you in advance

tosdr.tldr: This service may change the terms at any time, but they will notify the user - typically via email or their apps. Your continued use of the service is taken as acceptance of the new or changed terms.
tosdr.case: user is notified on the day

topics.description: Services need to evolve. But it is important that updating the service does not break the consentment with the user. Updates and changes to terms of service and privacy policy need to be properly noticed to users and to sollicit their agreement again.
topics.name: Notice of Changing Terms
topics.subtitle: Are users notified when terms change? Are they given enough time to find out what changed and discuss this with each other before deciding whether to continue to use the service under the new terms?
topics.title: Notice of Changing Terms

points.title: Your account could be cancelled without notice in certain circumstances

tosdr.tldr: Yahoo retains the right to cancel or limit your account at any time without notice to you in certain circumstances such as your failure to comply with terms of service, an extended period of inactivity, to comply with law enforcement or even for technical reasons. This could include deletion of your content or other information associated with or contained within your account.
